SENT.plain: Drug-induced dyscrasias (agranulocytosis, aplastic anemia, hemolytic anemia and thrombocytopenia) in Sweden during a 10-year period (1966-75) have been analyzed
The overall occurrence is remarkably constant, although marked changes have occurred with regard to offending drugs
Drug-induced thrombocytopenia and agranulocytosis are about twice as common as hemolytic anemia, which in turn is twice as common as aplastic anemia
There is a marked increase with age in the incidence of all drug-induced cytopenias
Women predominate and make up close to 70% of the material
With regard to responsible drugs, the most remarkable finding is the high frequency with which sulfonamides appear as responsible for all types of drug-induced cytopenia
